elements.2211.03219_64d191b8b07d2856185b418b697eb: The pervasive application of artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms is transforming many industries and aspects of the human experience
elements.2211.03219_060750f89b9ffa7b2e7da570eba92: One very important industry trend is the move to convert existing human dwellings to smart buildings, and to create new smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_5217ca5a01f757ed35b2ed80a5475: Smart buildings aim to mitigate climate change by reducing energy consumption and associated carbon emissions
elements.2211.03219_b723f1ffbc005cdf7711cfcb3bbb5: To accomplish this, they leverage artificial intelligence, big data, and machine learning algorithms to learn and optimize system performance
elements.2211.03219_4c5d37e9b307458689830dae3ed81: These fields of research are currently very rapidly evolving and advancing, but there has been very little guidance to help engineers and architects working on smart buildings apply artificial intelligence algorithms and technologies in a systematic and effective manner
elements.2211.03219_a29a41abd050b3346c9f9225d635b: In this paper we present B-SMART: the first reference architecture for autonomic smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_321b47ce27982719efc96a4500b62: B-SMART facilitates the application of artificial intelligence techniques and technologies to smart buildings by decoupling conceptually distinct layers of functionality and organizing them into an autonomic control loop
elements.2211.03219_fb91988c33a29c15dd7f5d95faebc: We also present a case study illustrating how B-SMART can be applied to accelerate the introduction of artificial intelligence into an existing smart building.
elements.2211.03219_a76c87580f197e7e641422e13da6f: B-SMART is a reference architecture that accelerates the application of artificial intelligence in smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_d71248c524f59c0ea4413da5f6fc7: B-SMART supports autonomic smart building operations
elements.2211.03219_85781d8b65abe6b1561ee78b07178: B-SMART supports both startup and ongoing commissioning
elements.2211.03219_58c0ab4e717040dd5df68a49df7c4: emissions and their longevity as well as the ability to reduce these values have made it a significant priority for emissions reduction
elements.2211.03219_e77ba6f8cdee28c9bd322205dd499: In this context, the ability to manage buildings most efficiently is critical
elements.2211.03219_ebfc1064a522334d961263da78f2d: Significant research and best practice development have formed a body of commissioning practices implemented throughout the building life-cycle that can reduce energy consumption by 15-30
elements.2211.03219_c3b7668c43036286bc4fea430ed47: Recent developments in machine learning and cloud computing provide new opportunities to implement Smart and Ongoing Commissioning (SOCx); preliminary field studies have demonstrated this approach to provide savings as high as 70
elements.2211.03219_c5674100fa5479e6fad5de25b39f8: However, there is limited uptake due to the lack of a supporting computational architecture to integrate machine learning and artificial intelligence with building systems
elements.2211.03219_c753c1754f27cbe3046231cb3fd1f: This paper seeks to address this research gap, building upon the state-of-the-art to present the first reference architecture for autonomic smart buildings to enable SOCx throughout the building life-cycle
elements.2211.03219_823f50f0b2a06e15b471ad3208e98: The Building Systems Management Autonomic Reference Template (B-SMART) can be used to dramatically accelerate the design of information systems, reduce the building energy footprint, and facilitate the application of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in smart buildings.
elements.2211.03219_45a82d4bf4fce1539952c43f1f675: In the key technical white-paper outlining their vision of autonomic computing
elements.2211.03219_865e51cf412532d9aa3808e7cbfe2: , IBM introduced the following definition of autonomic computing: "
elements.2211.03219_47fb41fa7aca6e8800103565a808e: This initial definition was fairly narrow, and since then significant research was done to expand the set of autonomic properties that need to be supported (discussed further in Sub-section
elements.2211.03219_249c0ab571c31d2b6c306c0a3c424: Also, autonomic computing environments and systems do not exist in a void
elements.2211.03219_5e8f46650943876969d1296abebaf: They must interact with other actors in their environment, and so in this work we define an autonomic cybernetic system or computing environment as follows: "
elements.2211.03219_24ba4d9d2136cfed4e4a10364a400: was initially defined as those buildings whose "design and construction require the integration of complex new technologies into the fabric of the buildingâ
elements.2211.03219_37bf1273b28442915811ea9c95dec: In the intervening decades, several new developments have expanded the definition of Smart Buildings, but at the core remains this need for integration of a diversity of new technologies including those yet to be developed
elements.2211.03219_634ee4b9ddb91a85c8a0bd0e78145: This anticipation of future learning has led to significant applications of artificial intelligence and machine learning within this domain
elements.2211.03219_8f0a65c93b5789796b9395a6785d8: Driven by the urgency of climate change, energy management has been a particular focus for this research with sub-focuses on monitoring, fault detection and diagnosis, and scheduling problems
elements.2211.03219_d1b6d4eb68ce3d41def381964991f: Advances in Building Information Modeling (BIM) have been developed to integrate the information required to support such Smart Building applications throughout the building life-cycle
elements.2211.03219_696aa98eb00f1709abecc6603635b: Complementing this, significant research has developed solutions for the streaming of Building Automation System (BAS) and other sensor network data
elements.2211.03219_bb5c2b2f5dc3a7b8605311e349033: However, legacy BAS systems pose a significant challenge to this integration
elements.2211.03219_605c1431b29371abf2fdd92504a59: Further complicating this challenge is the ever-evolving diversity of Internet of Things (IoT) devices and applications enabling Smart Building operations
elements.2211.03219_61481584d8918285bdc3165fb7399: Within this context of complex, heterogeneous systems integrated into Smart Buildings, the ongoing optimization of building performance is a significant challenge
elements.2211.03219_68148e17e4003471623028d391c83: SOCx is the integration of traditional commissioning processes with online monitoring and data analysis drawn from IoT devices and traditional building systems such as BAS to maintain optimum building performance
elements.2211.03219_4c60f68cc108d308fd4fcb46eadc3: These SOCx systems will benefit building operators and facility managers in three key ways: (1) a reduction in nuisance alarms and their automatic correction; (2) new insights into fault detection, including their resolution when human intervention is not required; (3) and improved energy performance of the facility
elements.2211.03219_8ec38c0358404304f6d1116d86ae0: Recognizing the diversity of data required to support these practices, several SOCx ontologies have been developed, as have data streaming approaches to collect these data
elements.2211.03219_98964d37dce78b526e3966d268916: and algorithms to support fault detection and energy optimization
elements.2211.03219_88fb93830f044d4748526544a2b7b: Despite this innovation, however, there remains a paucity of literature regarding autonomic smart building approaches
elements.2211.03219_4c0a576ac51401b95a99df4f5d906: Few autonomic architectures for smart buildings exist, and those currently representing the state-of-the-art fail to fully address the needs of SOCx processes as they lack key autonomic system properties
elements.2211.03219_a5b4a520189e9de8569109305b243: In addition, there remains a heavy reliance on manual data collection, transformation, and analysis to populate them, which are slow and expensive processes
elements.2211.03219_767786a442f16173a42099588f41a: This is a significant factor slowing smart building adoption
elements.2211.03219_082367f38778117a0cbadc38d9259: Ideally a smart building, like advanced Industrial IoT systems
elements.2211.03219_4d30cb3df8136b9491c8637b83e3f: , should be able to commission itself, re-commission itself if the situation calls for it, and maintain optimal systems performance on an on-going basis
elements.2211.03219_534fe9cf8ea4aa3581ddf8c5a44b9: The future of smart buildings is autonomic
elements.2211.03219_eaee63376e7b7d8e5c5f8851d1f2a: To overcome the barriers to implementation discussed above, we propose the first reference architecture developed specifically to address the needs of smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_96051f2c9e3611545186850af1b71: Our architecture supports all the key properties of autonomic systems and is tailored specifically to support SOCx implementation in Smart Buildings
elements.2211.03219_0ea58b4d197b8e4ec0f99406c7330: Through this contribution, we seek not only to enable their implementation, but to provide a guide for continuing research and development activities in this very important area
elements.2211.03219_8d923b801092b1e23ea5b94b117b8: This paper is laid out as follows
elements.2211.03219_1601fefe396332d3839dffd5543e5: First, we present a review of existing autonomic architectures for smart buildings, contextualized within the broader development of autonomic computing
elements.2211.03219_95884f301f07af3809f8d67698f04: Next, we outline our methodology, which draws from this literature review to develop the requirements for reference architecture development
elements.2211.03219_15e0e63ba985a4baec4a753e00e2b: , we present the B-SMART â the first reference architecture for autonomic smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_4a54389e8a1d62d10d8e22a98067d: we discuss how legacy BAS can be incorporated into B-SMART
elements.2211.03219_c2844ea1e91b8615376286f3db9b4: we discuss how B-SMART supports the SOCx processes
elements.2211.03219_8d99fc81bf3f0837178ba42c8c6e2: we present an example that illustrates how B-SMART can be applied on an existing smart building to help plan the development of additional smart building features
elements.2211.03219_cd157b65c6d6033b64e7418b590e5: Finally, we discuss the applications and implications for this reference architecture and conclude with a summary of our findings, the limitations of this work, and recommendations for future research.
elements.2211.03219_f042241f38b8f47861eaa1483b217: Recent advances in AI and Machine Learning (ML) have triggered evolutionary changes across many industries known as Industry 4.0
elements.2211.03219_a0219a6d12d3fb2fbe3196cb1c92c: Examples include self-driving cars, autonomous drones, robotic production lines, AI assisted medical diagnosis, social network algorithms, facial-recognition features in smart phones and cameras, and many other examples
elements.2211.03219_6b48413f710013a1f32fabef53b2c: Such modern autonomic systems pervasively apply ML algorithms to identify objects that collectively comprise their environment and classify them into useful categories
elements.2211.03219_ceed8eff99bc42bb6456182c8b063: Once detected and classified, the autonomic system needs to decide what actions need to be performed on, or in response to, those objects
elements.2211.03219_c56c5279c12165433108ab6ba8691: The actions to be performed could be either learned using ML algorithms or selected using a rules-based system
elements.2211.03219_f8e96d35a95609c64daa5eede0a28: Autonomous systems typically need to co-exist and interact with humans
elements.2211.03219_8e6e9ec6709279e63ddc1b8090be9: Human-in-the-loop systems typically identify and classify the objects in their environment, present a human operator with a proposed set of actions, and wait for the human to confirm which action should be taken
elements.2211.03219_d0c453dc5c61a738ad856ec3abd2e: Human-on-the-loop systems provide the human operator with the same level of information but do not wait for human operator to confirm; instead, the action will be performed automatically
elements.2211.03219_c82029accb520875e6d875ead48f2: The human operator will be able to observe and, if necessary, intervene in the autonomic cycle.
elements.2211.03219_08a79770c27c1696933a17cdcdf3a: The field of autonomic computing was introduced by IBM in 2001 with the goal of creating computer systems capable of self management
elements.2211.03219_94de698a31f4e4e290962d24139c9: Since then, there has been considerable research focusing on developing autonomic systems
elements.2211.03219_d45e0ee330cb558cadde71ad6e4a3: Originally IBM defined autonomic systems to exhibit the following characteristics:
elements.2211.03219_ec9a0df9aceb8f8e3903f1de667d7: The ability to configure its own components without human intervention.
elements.2211.03219_82e76fbf6a45a6f3d15c740c1bced: The ability to recognize and correct faults without human intervention.
elements.2211.03219_6d8d696903a8759824d069da45d90: The ability to monitor and optimize their own performance.
elements.2211.03219_68f7efc647fbfad8c85feb7e058ff: The ability of the system to detect intrusion and defend itself from its unwanted effects.
elements.2211.03219_2ae38dad1735a57b0467c2e8b4518: In 2005 IBM published its reference architecture for autonomic systems
elements.2211.03219_ce32d71eca6be675d6350bea3dc46: This reference architecture, referred to as MAPE-K, is shown in Figure
elements.2211.03219_eb7debde7b431c3e53f811f144568: The acronym MAPE-K stands for Monitor (M), Analyze (A), Plan (P), Execute (E), and Knowledge (K).
elements.2211.03219_92e076c766296b2a192cce603f99c: The IBM MAPE-K reference architecture remains the most widely used autonomic reference architecture today
elements.2211.03219_d91309d209c80a7fe0a02408c1916: For example, it is referenced in all works cited in Table 1 focusing on big data, networking, and cloud computing; note that the cited works focusing on the smart building space are not really autonomic architectures
elements.2211.03219_8e41a76554604b0222488669897e6: It was observed that key to the definition of autonomic systems was the notion of supporting certain autonomic system properties
elements.2211.03219_57e7cc74d790207d35c03de87efe0: MAPE-K is a conceptual architecture that does not provide guidance on how to effectively leverage the algorithms, techniques and technologies from the rapidly evolving AI domain when designing smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_8ab9726248a0a1cf77f3d366af867: Smart building developers would need to acquire deep AI skills and define a more domain-relevant architecture, complete with a technology mapping
elements.2211.03219_5abb89ca9c29814f709ce6ecdb677: To address this issue our autonomic reference architecture for smart buildingsuses the MAPE-K reference architecture as a starting point, and enhances it with domain specific insight
elements.2211.03219_c88bf16ee1ba6690de23589bb588c: have expanded these desirable characteristics to add:
elements.2211.03219_c0b502d2fa3d830b590099cc5d9e6: The ability to maintain a key parameter, such as the quality of service.
elements.2211.03219_814e690171633a9b09c4f9939be65: The ability to learn about its environment without external intervention.
elements.2211.03219_b027fc25f19e29fa7d59cfdef3bcc: The ability to be aware of its constituent components and key external dependencies.
elements.2211.03219_a73bce3b417b7d67ddfb36bd81bf0: The ability to the system to organize its own structure.
elements.2211.03219_48e2bd28d4213bafffd0d32aedd18: The ability to organize itself in response to changing strategic goals.
elements.2211.03219_17382c6796808fe3cf04945fcef21: The ability to manage all its constituent components.
elements.2211.03219_0236af4874add74018378b0b5bde0: Humans should be able to understand an autonomous system.
elements.2211.03219_9bc514622d798d0930843e5145404: The MAPE-K architecture does not explicitly explain how these autonomic properties should be implemented
elements.2211.03219_2e54229a7c3d1d20dcfe353313a41: Most autonomic architectures listed in Table
elements.2211.03219_161da903defec6af1f624c4308bc6: focus on implementing the self-optimization property
elements.2211.03219_2f432fe7e131df0c7664604cf4c7b: The other properties are not nearly as widely discussed in currently available scientific literature.
elements.2211.03219_ec0a9aaee9efef6304552363eee4e: There have been very few published studies focusing on how to make smart buildings autonomic
elements.2211.03219_a5e48c8cbb83192ac03fcb1f6bca7: None of them describe an autonomic reference architecture.
elements.2211.03219_28f4ac6f80be9ff3364751394af34: present a reference architecture for a smart building digital twin, which is used to model physical building performance
elements.2211.03219_4fbde9bcd970564a7de297f9f213b: Their reference architecture focuses on how to collect, store, and expose the static and dynamic information produced by smart buildings for query by human operators
elements.2211.03219_aa3faafb39a33703e074983e5f6bf: Their reference architecture does not specifically address the autonomic aspect of smart building operation, nor does it discuss the implementation of autonomic properties, encouraging instead human interaction with the digital twin.
elements.2211.03219_1879e25823a58b3fc8f764ba9a03a: describe a conceptual framework called Integrated Big Data Management and Analytics (IBDMA), a reference architecture, and a metamodel for smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_eb499cb043269a6eb51389d648c1b: The meta-model describes the different conceptual entities and processes that comprise the smart building, and how they interact with each other
elements.2211.03219_c8d1d17f72a10e72d462ae293f63a: The reference architecture describes how the big data stack technologies can be used to implement these processes. but do not discuss the autonomic properties, nor how these can be implemented in smart buildings.
elements.2211.03219_912615a7452c23c24a3604cf8eff9: also propose a reference architecture for smart and software defined buildings
elements.2211.03219_e41b094f8b67c648093788ee490a2: Their reference architecture also does not specifically focus on the autonomic aspects of managing smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_1f7020780f5a74462369e00568e65: It does include a layered view of smart building technologies
elements.2211.03219_7cf9a91f455b089ffdad627419015: The key layers include: Hardware; Network; Management; and Application and Service
elements.2211.03219_26cfa77c9b8862b1e338045ffd9d6: The study also discusses automating some of the smart building features but does not describe or discuss the implementation of autonomic properties by their architecture layers
elements.2211.03219_a85f72c1c59e2b92f72b0e2a1a75a: Their architecture targets the more conventional smart building that relies on human interaction rather than autonomic operation and is supplemented by a rules engine to manage and optimize building operation.
elements.2211.03219_9e60b3e3cad2cb55600ec6c71d44f: propose a self-managing architecture for multi-HVAC systems in buildings based on an âAutonomous cycle of Data Analysis Tasksâ (ACODAT) concept
elements.2211.03219_ac0ea3fa1195428d713116e6eb7de: While their work is a significant step towards defining an autonomic architecture for smart buildings, it has several shortcomings
elements.2211.03219_650375fe06ddb4baa495301e1a789: Their architecture does not explain layering, or separation of responsibilities among the different technologies
elements.2211.03219_5c69289de4a761c1b3c4cef1e5a2d: It also does not support several key autonomic systems properties â such as self-organization and self-creation
elements.2211.03219_c1a7bfc111d062b185127fc10ffc9: Further, this study focuses on the optimization aspect of a smart building already in operation, but do not engage with questions of new implementation where there will be no historical data to work with, and thus there must be a lengthy period when it will not be possible to optimize the building power consumption.
elements.2211.03219_eef997f88a17816ff5087bd474752: In summary, most prior works focus on implementing the self-configuration and self -optimization autonomic properties
elements.2211.03219_10854ac1980bd9d4230aa8b4cea72: The MAPE-K autonomic reference architecture, and especially the autonomic control loop described in it, is almost exclusively used
elements.2211.03219_1f86aa59cfd2197de3f2c1e42171b: All the reviewed architectures had a notion of technology layering
elements.2211.03219_ae0704b171ff0085d68fc403cdba3: Autonomic architectures can be either centralized or distributed
elements.2211.03219_3c1374ff3ffc41ad15536b07b1d81: Many autonomic architectures leverage ML algorithms and AI techniques that are often grouped into a separate cognitive layer which, among other things, is responsible for detecting change and updating the models
elements.2211.03219_2654f69bff6b6fed3d851a81af951: These observations have been reflected in the design of the B-SMART reference architecture, as discussed in the following sections.
elements.2211.03219_23a0a8524eaa46648400018181045: A reference architecture is typically created as a digest of existing architectures
elements.2211.03219_92744ecf0c7afef7be4ed9781fba7: It encapsulates the best practices learned by implementing architectures in the field and serves as a template for new architectures
elements.2211.03219_826c37a29f7876bbd0e2dc6491576: The objective of the reference architecture is to facilitate creation of new architectures, reduce costs associated with architectural design, and promote interoperability and standardization
elements.2211.03219_bfbd9d3b93e4fb4363c15d29678c0: The design process involved the following steps:
elements.2211.03219_f19ce773c4c0763b151b3cca78cad: Literature review focusing specifically on autonomic architectures for smart buildings.
elements.2211.03219_4f71ccce2f93ad999f93f51ba95e3: Literature review focusing on autonomic architectures developed in related computer science fields: 1 â big data analytics; 2 â cloud computing; 3 â networking.
elements.2211.03219_5d538718db8d3bdbf3924df58bc2e: A computational architecture concept based on MAPE-K was used as the starting point.
elements.2211.03219_c93ac4897fafb032f5ba97ce93f03: Conceptual layers were defined to ensure they were fully decoupled to avoid circular dependencies
elements.2211.03219_ed639d6e848baa418b2521926e72a: Each layer in the architecture was defined to support one or more of the key autonomic system properties.
elements.2211.03219_019ed697a6e1a4dff877139d7b3ec: A mapping of AI sub-domains to each layer was developed.
elements.2211.03219_42b5ec522866b51930ac37e44943f: A mapping of currently available technologies that could be used to implement each layer was provided to serve as an example of how to apply the reference architecture.
elements.2211.03219_c58af015bf3ad698c4e82342be4cb: A control loop was added to support autonomic functionality.
elements.2211.03219_0d70d24ec8bc1f7d203046fd71255: The B-SMART reference architecture was organized into three parts, or architectural views:
elements.2211.03219_7e2f0da5a6e658a6adc64ec4b3d43: : This view describes the high-level logical components that comprise the reference architecture.
elements.2211.03219_7aa50fec007a218584831f8124859: : This explains the static relationships between conceptual and technological layers and sub systems, and the responsibilities of each layer.
elements.2211.03219_30eb0169920353d5cff492fb5bc42: : This explains the dynamic relationships among the B-SMART technology layers and the relationship between the control loop and the SOCx processes.
elements.2211.03219_622892c6060f43931f71faf5e2615: The B-SMART High-Level Component Architecture of Autonomic Smart Buildings
elements.2211.03219_3d7eaa8ad372dc592554a722cdcf9: shows the high-level component architecture for autonomic smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_f1d28c765676d098a1cf99e806cc8: This diagram also shows main categories of information that must be stored and accessed by the components, and the primary relationships between the components and the data
elements.2211.03219_64e8829ff235b1c61a5ea716d1f33: The arrows indicate architectural relationships among the high-level components rather then the flow of data
elements.2211.03219_3d62651e0a0ea155e46716fa7ebe9: Corresponding functionality layers (discussed in sections below) from the B-SMART layered architecture view are shown in bold italics.
elements.2211.03219_db897158f2961dd6b7e51406c21ac: , Knowledge is the central and essential component of the IBM MAPE-K autonomic manager reference architecture
elements.2211.03219_c4879f90d7e4f137b7933dd30c98a: The B SMART reference architecture builds on this concept and defines essential types of information and knowledge repository organization required by the smart building autonomic manager
elements.2211.03219_5b6cab39834a5d78a87678c266aba: The B-SMART reference architecture does not mandate any specific implementation technologies, deployment physical form factor such asan on-premises appliance for example, or physical topology (distributed vs. centralized) for the BKR
elements.2211.03219_444e00da0824bba112671a61c211e: The BKR must be able to store the following categories of information:
elements.2211.03219_1155604fe7d7ca81f56046a2dda8a: Description and classification types of all key building systems capable of generating data.
elements.2211.03219_3490568efa18c4abcc495cf59b831: Manufacturerâs operating characteristics for sensors and actuators, and for the building systems.
elements.2211.03219_6b3b99799c1af54a1ec0dbe4a5842: Initial statistical baselines for all the smart building systems.
elements.2211.03219_89dbefd3410d78822cd0cfb47fd0b: Historical information characterizing the performance of the smart building systems.
elements.2211.03219_fb3d42c764c505d72ad0318c18350: Real-time information characterizing current performance of the smart buildingâs systems.
elements.2211.03219_867a90e098ca26071bc53b3263268: The rationale for requiring these information types is discussed in depth in sections focusing on Functionality and Technology Layering and the Autonomic Control Loop
elements.2211.03219_6c9473b3707bfc1557205ffaf0c09: The BKR should be subdivided into two zones which manage the building operating data (see Figure
elements.2211.03219_eabe0129496776308c38a55b21854: This zone contains data describing the current state of the smart building, and a small subset of data describing the building performance in the very recent (e.g. last 24 hours) past
elements.2211.03219_7e368a919feb9161661558afa36cd: These data are relatively volatile multi-variate time-series, that can include both raw data, results of real time data transformation, results of on-the-fly data aggregation, and near-real-time analytics
elements.2211.03219_b89fa1a5f1ded492a4c229ea62821: Performance characteristics of this zone must support high rates of inserts and updates as well as near-real-time operations on small volumes of data
elements.2211.03219_f166663f44607fad4a78cda8f190c: The B-SMART reference architecture does not mandate any specific time segment duration that needs to be stored in the Real Time Zone, leaving this for individual smart building implementations to determine
elements.2211.03219_9c9267ceeee5b60abbedf011ed19d: We recommend, however, that the Real Time Zone maintain at least data collected over the previous 24-hour period, in addition to data describing the current state of the building
elements.2211.03219_737f16136197b419aa9e07c936f4d: This is because the day-night cycle results in periodicity within smart building sensor data, that needs to accounted for as part of real-time analytic analysis
elements.2211.03219_94f1a4e8e47b387955aa46734c12f: The degree of availability and fault tolerance which the Real Time Zone supports should be determined by individual smart building implementations based on each clientâs ability to absorb the extra costs associated with sub-optimal energy performance versus the cost of supporting these qualities of service.
elements.2211.03219_92bdeb94833a2666337ea2c816f10: This zone contains data describing the technical specifications and the historical performance characteristics of the building
elements.2211.03219_0573f6f283f3c243dcb57ec7eed5d: Data could be in the form of multi-variate time series containing raw or transformed data, relations, analytic reports summarizing the building performance, and relations containing building equipment specifications
elements.2211.03219_e759390aff4228c7148912f9e4612: The Historical Data Zone may also contain persistent storage for rules used by the smart building AI
elements.2211.03219_cbff69a0eedb5a1700fa1c5e50bb0: Performance characteristics of this zone must support fast analytics on large volumes of data (relative to the Real Time zone) and batch updates
elements.2211.03219_b3889c41cab9fb4747ed8a96066c2: The B-SMART reference architecture does not mandate any specific duration for the time segment of data that must be stored in the Historical Time Zone, but we recommend that at least one year of historical data is retained to enable predictive analytics that need to account for seasonal trends in the multivariate time series data

elements.2211.03219_23c623f204dda175835f3a5f9db1c: Change detection is a very important stage in autonomic processing
elements.2211.03219_82e10f31506d11214c35593546ee4: Several researchers working on autonomic systems in various domains noted that continuous optimization incurs an overhead and reduces the eventual benefit (e.g.

elements.2211.03219_bd737042b46f9b461b91a5b0bf629: Changes can be broadly classified into two types:
elements.2211.03219_0ba0a83e2bbff1777b6f787f15a20: Change detection can be implemented using a variety of techniques including, but not limited to, Bayesian statistical methods, clustering algorithms, or supervised machine learning methods
elements.2211.03219_58243ba9f6e4c67d7144b606a293c: These can be used to identify faults and concept drift affecting the buildingâs HVAC systems and other peripheral systems such as solar panels, shading systems, elevators, security, communications, etc
elements.2211.03219_24161faa0ddd3143e114bff6d5441: Computer vision techniques can be used to detect changes in building occupancy levels, broken pipes and other mechanical failures affecting the building systems, or other warning signs (e.g. flooding, fire, and smoke)
elements.2211.03219_691dbd7d599c666e17e8ad21b10dd: CDO layer code is packaged and deployed as part of the RT Analytics and Batch Analytics components
elements.2211.03219_d3d2e6233558d6788f2272cb5ad45: Once changes are detected, they can trigger one of three types of optimization response: a parameter search without engaging the Interfacing layer, a parameter space search engaging the Interfacing layer, or the direct engagement of the Interfacing layer without a parameter space search.

elements.2211.03219_fdd5db76812498a7df4f22d16a2d5: The human inhabitants of the smart building need to be able to interact with the building to adapt the building environment to suit their comfort level
elements.2211.03219_09d19aec51f8ae3d7026195964a67: Currently a common interaction involves adjusting the temperature setting of the smart meter or filling in a Web-based form indicating the comfort level or lack there of
elements.2211.03219_2a6ec95b17ebba98a7592fcb4b85a: Future interaction techniques should focus on NLP and video as primary interaction channels between the tenant and the smart building AI
elements.2211.03219_2b596c49e3b09c7aa4e1a1087b818: The interactions between the tenants and the smart building could be initiated by either party, but most commonly it will be the tenants who will contact the smart building AI to address a particular concern.

elements.2211.03219_8928b192f976cb0e2a40487904a0e: These interactions could be focused on routine maintenance or as a response to detected faults
elements.2211.03219_b2b201432b87cc889cea1adc570c6: For example, if the smart CDO layer detects that the sensors responsible for controlling the building chiller are reporting erroneous values, the Interfacing layer will contact the appropriate building maintenance technician
elements.2211.03219_d99cc945754daf7cef4eb3a7fd865: To determine which technician to contact, and how to contact him or her, the Interfacing layer may engage a rules engine
elements.2211.03219_e88b355e3463e0a04eb2977f175b9: While today most interactions will involve contacting the maintenance technician via e-mail, or text message, future directions should encourage NLP voice interactions between the smart building AI and these human actors.
elements.2211.03219_0d59a7fc1b42b5275fb9d87b16226: Vehicles frequently need to interact with smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_ef5cc9175afae367717c904e3cd58: One example of such an interaction could involve a human driver contacting the smart building to enquire about the availability of parking spaces and charging stations for electric vehicles
elements.2211.03219_d08e1cd275bb40bd13d800521a1d2: The B-SMART architecture encourages the use of voice and video channels and NLP techniques to accomplish these types of interactions.
elements.2211.03219_9cc0db62516661ab20c80d0361eac: One example of such an interaction could involve a human driver contacting the smart building to inquire about the availability of parking spaces and charging stations for electric vehicles
elements.2211.03219_b16f8c26a8fd2439ec4f4d7b3f7e7: Other smart buildings may have indirect relationships with the target building, for example through connection to the same smart grid, or direct relationships, for example through shared ownership, occupants, or building systems.
elements.2211.03219_9c2f2a9433e232cbfecfbcde73ec5: As with human-driven vehicles autonomous driving vehicles will need to interact with smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_805d9570d94e16a3303f5f06e405e: B-SMART architecture encourages the use NLP, rather than APIs, as the universal communication interface for both human-driven and autonomous vehicles
elements.2211.03219_8c8f4590eb2fad0b29ad6b3210ba4: The main advantage of this approach is that NLP-based communication can be readily understood and audited by humans.
elements.2211.03219_abd9e997637bed2b9cb26123442b1: The smart building AI will likely need to communicate with other AIs, such as Googleâs Google or Appleâs Siri, to perform its functions or accommodate queries from its residents
elements.2211.03219_8c0ef927cdb17333a661c0a4603a5: One example could involve an inquiry by a building resident about upcoming weather conditions in the immediate vicinity of the smart building
elements.2211.03219_f715ad320954c832d1fbf4f17388f: This query, after pre-processing to augment it with the precise location of the building, could be passed on to another AI that specializes in this type of query
elements.2211.03219_6673447aaa9b3802bf753cb9b8cac: B-SMART encourages the use of NLP techniques for these types of interactions to facilitate auditing by humans.

elements.2211.03219_f332018adffd55de86d929a71f032: The Interfacing layer leverages the information stored in the BKR to establish the current state of the smart building and to communicate relevant information to human and non-human autonomic actors
elements.2211.03219_e47c82797080638c4cbd7c5dad7cc: The NLP sub-layer supports Text, Voice, and Video communication with human actors
elements.2211.03219_18206bbef1bfca6927b5bb3b05faa: The B-SMART reference architecture strongly encourages the use of NLP-based communications because they can be easily understood and audited by human actors with little to no IT and computer science knowledge
elements.2211.03219_86f0ef730c31799e69758a99d8352: As discussed earlier in this work, the need to hire or acquire IT skills is a major inhibitor in smart building adoption
elements.2211.03219_928d8fbcfc3d779a5023d46e55b03: The Translation sub-layer converts verbal and text natural language queries into queries that can be understood by the Native Query Interface sub-layer that is used by the BKR implementation
elements.2211.03219_67775d9712e38f755fbe002a3fb8b: The B-SMART reference architecture does not mandate any specific implementation for the Native Query Interface sub-layer
elements.2211.03219_c378452d176a3f8a108d6c3e92ec0: Each commercial or open-source technology will likely provide their own database-specific implementation of this layer
elements.2211.03219_fdf471ffbb13057013ea8c10fc0e0: The B-SMART reference architecture encourages the development of new technologies to implement the NLP and Translation sub-layers
elements.2211.03219_2f495a2ea61d9282223d4b9354965: To fully implement the self-description property, the smart building must be able to query the BKR and return the relevant information to the correct external actor
elements.2211.03219_e29784c00bef9879fdb542262b4ab: Interactions between the smart building and human actors could include financial reporting, technical reporting, proactive maintenance requests, interactions with the building occupants regarding their comfort level, and reactive maintenance requests
elements.2211.03219_9bee382371af02affd79a777a0703: These interactions could be implemented using either exposed APIs or via using NLP
elements.2211.03219_8c1d000e9f08bb4ab6ac78e6dd663: To implement self-healing, configurable rules would determine which actions need to be performed for a given failure scenario, and in which sequence
elements.2211.03219_8fe4259cf63fb8be0557beb399a54: For example, if a power failure is detected, the smart building could automatically start the back-up power generator
elements.2211.03219_d331d958fe5fadf57de3f728e6d83: The building could also send notifications of the event to human actors responsible for building maintenance
elements.2211.03219_e27959862397c4e425aa0b1ea16d4: Once the building detects that the main power is back on, it would stop the back-up power generator and switch to the main power supply
elements.2211.03219_0b629adcdf94408da15a2f477a258: There are many other failure scenarios, some of which may involve self-healing, while other would require intervention by external human or autonomic actors.

elements.2211.03219_45abfe07436938da388da190fff26: presents the state transition diagram for an autonomic smart building
elements.2211.03219_4ec2027b63b09095d1a21320224f3: While the start-up commissioning SOCx process is on-going the autonomic smart building remains in theâInitializingâ state
elements.2211.03219_8513fa169eaac489274b3bfc214de: Once the start-up SOCx process deploys the BKR and populates it with initial operating parameters the building transitions into the âOptimizingâ state, because, at this point in time, the optimal operating parameters for the building systems have not yet been established
elements.2211.03219_e121bb4f1d09a495bee5644e15590: Once the optimal operating parameters have been found the building transitions into the âDetecting Changeâ state.
elements.2211.03219_5376a6577671084a3dd4df11a7ad8: The smart building remains in this state until the CDO layer code detects one of two change events
elements.2211.03219_60ac0f0c042ba066baa3d1c5ae4e7: If the change event is classified as concept drift, the smart building transitions into the âOptimizingâ state, during which the parameter space search is performed
elements.2211.03219_dd3c0244771895d8ba02bfd59f5a0: Once the new optimum is found the smart building transitions back into the âDetecting Changeâ state
elements.2211.03219_e8cab1f09f6b962298026c5932cdd: If the change is classified as a fault, the smart building transitions into âInterfacingâ state
elements.2211.03219_2b391d0fde3da1c8fd21ac35a84ad: While in this state the Interfacing layer code interacts with external actors to resolve the fault condition
elements.2211.03219_1493b150d6d599651364d911b5c95: Once the fault is resolved, if repairs do not involve changing, adding, or upgrading BE systems, the smart building transitions back into the âDetecting Changeâ state
elements.2211.03219_fc2754518c34d314f4ad651514674: If the building systems are changed, added, or upgraded, the maintenance personnel will send a message to the Interfacing layer to put the building into the âInterfacingâ state
elements.2211.03219_4cd4ebb25912e9ed0eb1da5dbff1c: During the upgrade procedure the building will transition into the âInitializingâ state
elements.2211.03219_cfbd0be8cc65a5fee509999d826b8: Once the new initial operation characteristics have been entered into the BKR, the building transitions into the âOptimizingâ state
elements.2211.03219_7c274139349eb11ebe37ecbff31b1: This flow is exactly the same as for the start-up commissioning process described above.
elements.2211.03219_09c5e7fef3a7cdde64e3af9cb59da: Reacting to Changes in the Building Equipment
elements.2211.03219_6d98bc63e0e316c37bd8c0a202592: Conversion from a traditional building to a smart building will likely be performed iteratively
elements.2211.03219_9cd184d5fb971233e321903d2862d: As new sensors and BE systems are added to the building, external actors responsible for installing them notify the Interfacing layer
elements.2211.03219_1d1916a6ff6db0b13223e9434a27b: Sensor data feeds are automatically discovered by the Fabric layer, classified by the D
elements.2211.03219_29d402857d4dcfd7b02f6c7428034: C layer, and integrated into the data stream by the Integration layer
elements.2211.03219_44d5561ce39d6eb1623a273b808ea: The Interfacing layer communicates with the external actors to populate the BKR with information describing the newly added systems and sensors and rules describing how to handle failures affecting these systems
elements.2211.03219_5f7b7e362f7222b64c444e091ba14: The CDO layer automatically initiates parameter space search on any newly discovered systems
elements.2211.03219_606c4a777fbda7ea19b7c3dc92a1d: Once optimal operating parameters are established, they are stored in the BKR
elements.2211.03219_d1e9ee38b56deaed18bbaf5886845: The CDO layer adds the newly installed systems to the monitoring and change detection activities
elements.2211.03219_27fc9518dc4f764d0da9054181a1f: These interactions comprise the SOCx on-going commissioning process.
elements.2211.03219_48a9f416763aff583720e651072c7: Integrating with Legacy Building Automation Systems (BAS)
elements.2211.03219_24f384c6c66af94f3f72876c35ff1: Many traditional buildings are equipped with legacy BAS
elements.2211.03219_07d7b16f43cda6762c8a2bebc21dd: These systems may implement some of the capabilities described in B-SMART but will not have the same degree of autonomic functionality and functional and technological decoupling
elements.2211.03219_33e8d8d27c8ffb60b10b7358679e7: Legacy BAS are not currently capable of automatic discovery and classification of the different sensors and actuators but rely on manual configuration, the D
elements.2211.03219_273856f304a29ecf49ede4db73761: C functionality must be provided separately
elements.2211.03219_ae522ef612550c135237e5df60763: In those situations when BAS expose APIs that allow it to send messages with payload describing the state of systems managed by the BAS to the Streaming Platform they can be integrated with the other smart building components
elements.2211.03219_bc3e96a9ea71b034d28261910d319: The Integration layer code packaged in the Steaming Engine can then incorporate these data into the multi-variate time-series that form the smart building data stream
elements.2211.03219_e74cf95ab07098976be13c0556300: These data can then be captured in the Real Time and Historical Data Zones of the BKR
elements.2211.03219_5710864c653892fb2522461a72dcf: These data can then be operated on by the CDO layer code packaged in the RT Analytics component (see Figure
elements.2211.03219_75c3d2b17bf9f944549c6736d5ced: Legacy BAS systems also typically provide dashboards accessible over the Web
elements.2211.03219_911eef9313f83564b23bb6a0acab8: This allows for an on-the-glass integration strategy in addition, or as an alternative to, message-level integration
elements.2211.03219_ad32ef73d4093a24dd06cf97a3d1a: This integration strategy will require the Interfacing layer code packaged in the Building AI component (see Figure
elements.2211.03219_c96d7db0a748343c5eb52b170eb5d: ) to display and/or describe using NLP contents of the dashboard elements exposed by the legacy BAS
elements.2211.03219_c82e2acc3a92208da56959437d330: The B-SMART preferred integration strategy is message-level integration, on the middle tier, via message-oriented middleware
elements.2211.03219_bf085f131d152beac5b31f776a480: This successful integration approach was described, for example, in a case study by El Mokhtari et al. (El Mokhtari, et al., 2022)
elements.2211.03219_f593f206b91467107826cd324cbd2: Alternate integration strategies involving the database and presentation tier are likely to be complicated by the fact that legacy systems need to adhere to more limited data models and user interfaces than those implemented using the latest AI technologies.
elements.2211.03219_30704da574a109d795ee1fcbee625: There are two SOCx processes to consider:
elements.2211.03219_d40a558559881d0c09ce8e633b03e: Autonomic smart buildings must support both processes
elements.2211.03219_44bbaabf2d8048203922ee7a66382: Sections below discuss how this can be accomplished in more detail.
elements.2211.03219_7deed28509749a353f4adba7747e4: Start-up commissioning of smart buildings (as different from and in addition to activities performed during the commissioning of traditional buildings) must include:
elements.2211.03219_74dae616f0a4b60729b7ddcee6d6f: Identifying all of the sensors and actuators used by the BE layer systems.
elements.2211.03219_81433f4e9a3d6385c591d5b01cc7f: Ensuring that the data being generated by the sensors has values within the standard operating parameters established by the manufacturers of both the sensor and the BE system that it instruments.
elements.2211.03219_f3dd4ac5b9dfa9d11577da3040079: Capturing and storing the statistical baselines for each piece of equipment.
elements.2211.03219_21511b424454af4e35d4a635001f1: Creating and populating the BKR with above data.
elements.2211.03219_9f5a2a67db736104f393fecd8d4dc: Start-up commissioning involves leveraging the functionality provided by the D
elements.2211.03219_afa0e1b3c89d0e48e3d6c71f4dbe7: C layer and the Integration layer code to establish the data streams that will continuously update the BKR
elements.2211.03219_6a4458132f845154f4312927f4ae9: The autonomic control loop starts once the start-up commission process successfully completes
elements.2211.03219_9a27149352ee28edd8c7e8a77cbad: Monitor functionality of the CDO layer is used to analyze the incoming data
elements.2211.03219_589a0d7139aab8d2f08335604f4a0: Change detection functionality of the same layer is used to identify situations that require an action to be performed by the autonomic smart building manager
elements.2211.03219_47bb93bb50e31c8c05c8dee470c40: The Integration layer includes and supports the Start-Up Commissioning process
elements.2211.03219_d14729d18ebc4be5d7ec394ba7bc6: Another way to look at this relationship is to consider that one of the key goals of the start-up commissioning process for a smart building must include achieving tight integration of all sensors and actuators, and legacy BIM/BMS, with layers implementing higher-level autonomic functionality
elements.2211.03219_87e2a130cbcdce3e4a5188e5988f5: The start-up commissioning process bootstraps the main autonomic control loop of the smart building by populating the BKR
elements.2211.03219_ee4e9df086dbd03d6debfbc50659e: The Interfacing layer coordinates both the start-up commissioning SOCx stage, and the on-going SOCx commissioning activities
elements.2211.03219_4e11d4b5c460781b232e866ac07af: While the ultimate goal is to fully automate these activities, it is understood that at least in the near-term future most will require interaction with human actors.
elements.2211.03219_68ba2306b1495e6d017e80a4a58a0: Throughout the building lifecycle the CDO layer and Interfacing layer code update data stored int the BKR
elements.2211.03219_73f2dfcda996c6f7b1d2fe1a93ddb: Building state transitions shown in Figure
elements.2211.03219_511c954c023d4f5e09503dcf8bf94: comprise the on-going commissioning process of the SOCx
elements.2211.03219_61295c23807fbf26aab60de488f6d: Whenever the CDO layer code detects change and triggers an optimization of the building operating parameters, this action in effect represents automated re-commissioning of some of the smart buildings systems
elements.2211.03219_370903de3f68bbd7e1e9017a041ef: Once the new optimum is found it is recorded in the BKR, creating a new baseline for the smart building
elements.2211.03219_ddbd3b109d96f22c2ed3129e588ab: Transition from the Optimize stage to the Detect Change stage also forms a part of the on-going commissioning process
elements.2211.03219_b5d82a12ffcdeb71ee9980f2f9721: Once the CDO layer code identifies a fault and invokes the Interfacing layer to engage external actors, such as the building maintenance staff, it has in effect triggered re-commissioning of some of the buildings systems and forms a part of the on-going commissioning process
elements.2211.03219_640408bed435eb367b8ee404a3c1a: The on- going SOCx process can be generalized to involve the following steps:
elements.2211.03219_ad63f938d31cd09fb4268d4bb302f: If the building is in a steady state, then no re-commissioning of systems is needed.
elements.2211.03219_553600bbd9331c2043e87365591c6: If the change is a fault, then external actors need to repair or replace some of the buildings systems
elements.2211.03219_7faf197d48e4c26e6b7bc79fc6f14: If the change is not a fault, then this step is skipped.
elements.2211.03219_0ff13c98f2cf175bc051d7a3273a0: Performance of newly repaired or replaced components must be automatically optimized.
elements.2211.03219_0624e4a36bfec9f783637e345fbc5: Newly established optimal operating characteristics need to be stored in the BKR and become the new baseline for the CDO layer code.
elements.2211.03219_6e3fdfe53bff8a786855b64d75a48: The B-SMART autonomic reference architecture is thus designed to natively support both the start-up commissioning and on-going commissioning processes for smart buildings.
elements.2211.03219_19af8ce5f97027e1cb17ebdfcc978: , reference architectures are used to accelerate the software and systems design cycle
elements.2211.03219_633250669215cf5c6a87d9b63ca74: This section presents an example case study during which we applied the B-SMART reference architecture on an existing smart building to map out the research and development road map for future enhancements
elements.2211.03219_f22a50d5b171ff35fd450ede8bcbd: The Daphne Cockwell Complex (DCC) building of the Toronto Metropolitan University campus has been a showcase smart building and was used for our case study
elements.2211.03219_1f697d94eaccbfdab518e0491f733: Smart building research conducted on the DCC has been presented at many scientific conferences
elements.2211.03219_64e1e67df40fac3395ce31810c13e: Although this building has been extensively instrumented and studied, the general consensus is that it's journey to becoming a truly autonomic smart building is far from complete
elements.2211.03219_c3e44e4e9e8061f16dc654de16853: In sub-sections below we first present a fit-gap analysis of the DCC relative to our B-SMART reference architecture.

elements.2211.03219_8df4657947c5dc0ca78ad520d70c4: The DCC Streaming Platform component is implemented using the Apache Kafka messaging platform deployed in the Amazon Cloud
elements.2211.03219_4e20ae697c5a8a31d5adafc79db26: Custom Python scripts are used to route change-of-value messages from the DCC BAS system to topics on the Kafka broker
elements.2211.03219_f1f11a26ce05661d44a94d0e8ac80: The Streaming Engine component is implemented using custom Python code that picks up messages from Kafka topics, extracts payload contents, transforms the contents to the format required by the Amazon Timesteam database, and persists that data in that database
elements.2211.03219_bbb8f360cabc3dd399b19cab3ff4c: The BKR is currently implemented using the Amazon Timestream database
elements.2211.03219_3d058564f00a961ad4080d27a81da: This database is optimized for storing and working with time-series data
elements.2211.03219_589161d849f3576459a43eba315a0: The database stores raw sensor change-of-value data
elements.2211.03219_74d66a313595c4de263c5f4696aa4: This database is used to store both real-time data, and to perform historical data analysis
elements.2211.03219_a964ae5c9f0ac94641daa23f831f0: Building equipment specifications and the relationships among them (ontology) are stored in the neo4j graph database
elements.2211.03219_ac375e34249d07e5855131455df8c: Although there is no dedicated rules engine, some of the building operating rules are stored in the DCC Archibus data base.
elements.2211.03219_4e6570d56bd7ed7607160a86a553f: Currently there is no Building AI that oversees, monitors, and coordinates the DCC systems, and is capable of interacting with other actors as described in the Sub-section
elements.2211.03219_af4b3f667a13745afed04fbc61e00: Although some of the building systems are capable of semi-autonomous operation, they are not coordinated in any way
elements.2211.03219_de62e30845ca7549990cd3a88d05d: For example, the DCC is equipped with an adjustable shading system
elements.2211.03219_ece547ebadaecce60570a598dc2df: The automatically operated shades adjust position based on a pre-programmed schedule
elements.2211.03219_5aa93f835f9ffb4ac578ac3cae709: The building cooling and heating systems also adjust the chiller and boiler set points based on a pre-programmed schedule
elements.2211.03219_f6d8a9be6e6a6d9db2f498d6940fa: These schedules, however, are pre-programmed separately by human maintenance personnel
elements.2211.03219_a2263dd4a2e7b16a7cedfe81ad461: The two systems are not aware of each other

elements.2211.03219_ae3de0dc87a0a4981c573fa6d4056: Smart buildings, and by extension smart cities, represent a new and rapidly evolving field
elements.2211.03219_6b14d3e9ba537bd4941f718cb6312: Smart buildings are generally designed and developed by multi-disciplinary teams that include the more traditional engineers and architects, computer scientists, and IT personnel
elements.2211.03219_742ac59535916040ebe6fec54917e: Although the rapidly advancing field of AI presents great opportunities for enabling smart buildings with intellect, today little exists to help guide these teams in this endeavor
elements.2211.03219_c713476150b9ee374e6637187f963: The B-SMART component model presents a proven, repeatable pattern that demonstrates how to combine AI technologies and big data into a coherent autonomic solution
elements.2211.03219_a7be50d47a636b86d60c9860fd652: The layering of the B-SMART architecture encourages different vendors to build interoperable solutions
elements.2211.03219_535be2082a024cf10aa47d92ead66: Systems integrators working on implementing smart buildings should be better able to mix and match products from different vendors to suit their building requirements
elements.2211.03219_a6aa48682070fdbf98171aab0c75c: This can bring additional benefits when we consider smart cities
elements.2211.03219_429e0865d9af8b5464f31b9cb350f: For example, basing the Interfacing layer for all smart buildings on NLP will eventually enable smart builds in a smart city to literally talk to each other, as well as to their human occupants and maintenance personnel, in a manner that can be readily understood by humans who donât have IT training
elements.2211.03219_f77f7f4c31345e602bf02f3f6968f: The main limitation of this study is related to the general level of maturity of the smart builds field
elements.2211.03219_8efdb3869b192361b4f9e87a87b5d: This field is still very young and is far from maturity
elements.2211.03219_32adf3dab537932e52a70c979ff74: There are very few documented examples of autonomic smart builds
elements.2211.03219_d55a492ce26248dfbeeacba04de58: Despite this limitation, B-SMART represents a significant advance in this area and will stimulate both technological advances and architectural maturation of this important field of engineering
elements.2211.03219_7a2f87e56aecd74b4d352f05b6d66: Leveraging B-SMART to speed up the architectural design cycle for a smart building will reduce the costs associated with implementing a smart building, will improve the success rate for these projects, and will reduce resistance to converting traditional buildings to smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_54e3453d1180891c94c67debe9489: It will produce smart building designs that are well liked by building occupants and are able to evolve and improve by iterative introduction of new technologies over time.
elements.2211.03219_a3fa6966d2571d71310545b51d6a4: In this paper we presented the Building Systems Management Autonomic Reference Template (B-SMART) - the first reference architecture for autonomic smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_450bf63b434bea909be4262eae4af: The B-SMART reference architecture is designed to guide the development of new generation of autonomic building automation systems for smart buildings
elements.2211.03219_209350fd1e04df5b80721197506ae: B-SMART can dramatically reduce the duration and cost of the IT and software design cycle for smart buildings by providing IT architects and software developers working on smart builds with a clear pattern to follow
elements.2211.03219_b07867be1fe949b3244b798b236e6: Our reference architecture explains how to apply a wide range of AI, IoT, and big data technologies to construct a coherent autonomic smart building solution
elements.2211.03219_9cb54a7580dd89272c68723c2bdb8: It encourages decoupling of functionality and independent evolution for key technologies used to construct smart buildings, and encourages standardization and interoperability among smart buildings, smart grids, and smart cities
elements.2211.03219_1029e46135df02e85ff5df27689a3: B-SMART is designed to support the critically important SOCx processes
elements.2211.03219_6864451e61accda6fbd2b74b1610d: This contributes to the ongoing discourse within the AEC community regarding Smart Building performance optimization, providing a framework for the development of future SOCx systems to optimize and maintain building performance
elements.2211.03219_e52dbb28045334b1a79cb2a8120a4: We also presented an example application of B-SMART by developing a technology road map for the DCC smart building of the Toronto Metropolitan University campus
elements.2211.03219_8459495abec037e8091349e7c9174: This road map will serve as a guide for research and development activities focusing on DCC for the next five years.
